Header: At weiner contest, defending champs are top dog
Content: Fireworks, music and the pursuit of hot dogs marked the 242nd year of independence for the United States on what is expected to be a steamy Wednesday (July 4) in much of the country.In New York City’s Coney Island, contestants at the annual Nathan’s Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest scarfed down as many wieners as possible in what has become a televised event now in its 46th year. Defending women’s champion, Miki Sudo, furiously chomped her way to a record-breaking fifth consecutive Nathan’s title with 37 hot dogs. Ten-time champion Joey Chestnut took home his 11th mustard belt at Nathan’s after putting away 74 hot dogs in 10 minutes, according to ESPN which broadcast the event.. This is the 102nd year of the contest and it was held at Nathan’s original restaurant.
